Once again, Tompkins' "People, Places and Things In Henri Joly's 
Legend in=
 Japanese Art" comes to the rescue with a reference on p. 
122 and p. 544 i=
n addition to the one you found on p. 43, Ron.

Unfortunately my copy of Le=
gend is not here at the moment, so someone 
else will have to look those up=
 and report.

Craig Harris

e Art" on

ou

>

-volume set "Tsuba" and "Kodogu" by (I think) H.U.B. Velag--

ation from a few years ago--the Kodogu volume shows a

an owl being used as falcon bait, and a kogai 
(K-
>11)showing an owl on a =
tree branch. Each item has a description of

ness of the owl (poor guy).
